QUALITY

Forbes and Walker Tea Brokers
MOST COMPREHENSIVE WEBSITE ON TEA
www.forbestea.com
Page 2
Page 2
COMMENTS
Auction offerings totalled 6.6 M/Kg. Large Leaf teas met with reasonably good demand except for the PEK grade. High & Medium Small Leaf teas continued to be weak and a bearish sentiment all round primarily following plainer quality.
Ex-Estate offerings were similar to last and totalled 1.0 M/Kgs. Overall quality of teas showed no change with a greater majority of the offerings comprising of average to plain quality teas.
A few select BOP/BOPF's in the higher price bracket in the Western category were firm and dearer following special inquiry, whilst the others were irregular and easier. In the Below Best category, a small selection of BOP's appreciated by Rs. 50 per kg and more following special inquiry, whilst the others declined by a similar margin. Corresponding BOPF's too followed a similar trend. At the lower end BOP's were firm and Rs. 20-40 per kg dearer, whilst the corresponding BOPF's were irregular and mostly easier following quality. Nuwara Eliya BOP's were up to Rs. 50 per kg easier, whilst the corresponding BOPF's continued to sell around last. Uda Pussellawa BOP's - A few clean leaf teas continued to sell well, whilst the others too were firm and marginally dearer. Corresponding BOPF's were barely steady. Uva BOP's were firm and Rs. 20-30 per kg dearer, whilst the corresponding BOPF's declined by a similar margin and more.
CTC teas - BP1's had hardly any offerings all round. High & Mid Grown PF1's in the higher price bracket were weaker by up to Rs. 50 per kg, whilst the others continued to sell around last. Corresponding Low Grown PF1's declined by Rs. 50 per kg and more.
Less activity from shippers to the UK and the continent, whilst there was selective buying from shippers to Japan and South Africa. Shippers to the CIS and Middle East continued to be active at lower levels.
Low Growns comprised of 2.9 M/Kgs.  The Leafy, Semi-Leafy and Tippy catalogues met with fair demand.
In the Leafy and Semi-Leafy catalogues, well-made BOP1's witnessed  firm demand, whilst the balance together with the bolder varieties declined. OP1's were generally firm. Well-made OP's sold around last levels, whilst the balance were easier. Select Best OPA's appreciated, whilst the Best and Below Best varieties were lower. Teas at the bottom sold at last levels. High-priced PEK's appreciated, whilst the balance were lower. However, teas at the bottom sold around last levels. PEK1's, in general, were firm.
In the Tippy catalogue, Select Best FBOP's were firm, whilst the Best, Below Best and bolder varieties were easier. Balance sold around last levels. A few Select Best FBOPF1's
were firm, whilst the balance together with the Best and Below Best were easier. Teas at the bottom were firm on last.
In the Premium catalogue, a selection of high-priced Leafier Tippy teas held firm, whilst the balance eased.
********************************
FORBES & WALKER TEA BROKERS (PVT) LTD SALE OF - 27TH/ 28TH MAY 2025
Forbes and Walker Tea Brokers
MOST COMPREHENSIVE WEBSITE ON TEA
www.forbestea.com
Page 3
Page 3
MARKET
Selective and easier following quality
HIGH GROWN TEAS
BOP
Best Western's - A few select invoices were firm and dearer following special inquiry, whilst the others were irregular and easier by Rs. 50 per kg and more. In the Below Best category, a selection of teas appreciated by Rs. 50 per kg and more following special inquiry, whilst the others declined by a similar margin and more. Teas at the lower end of the market were firm and Rs. 20-40 per kg dearer. Nuwara Eliya's were up to Rs. 50 per kg easier. Uda Pussellawa's - A few select clean leaf teas continued to sell well at firm to marginally dearer rates, whilst the others which commenced firm appreciated by Rs. 20-30 per kg as the sale progressed. Uva's were firm and Rs. 20-30 per kg dearer.
BOPF
Best Western's - A few select invoices appreciated following special inquiry, whilst the others were irregular and easier following quality. In the Below Best category, a few select invoices were Rs. 20-40 per kg dearer, whilst the others were irregular and easier. Plainer sorts were irregular and easier following quality. Nuwara Eliya's sold around last. Uda Pussellawa's were barely steady. Uva's were up to Rs. 50 per kg easier.
OP/OPA
Well-made varieties declined by Rs. 40-60 per kg, whilst the others and poorer sorts were easier by Rs. 60-80 per kg.
PEKOE/PEKOE1
Flavoury PEK's declined in demand and were mostly unsold.  Orthodox Leafy PEK's were lower by Rs. 60-80 per kg. Best PEK1's were easier by Rs. 40 per kg, whilst the others decline by Rs. 60-80 per kg. A selection of Best Rotovane PEK's gained considerably following special inquiry, whilst the others were irregular and mostly lower following quality. Poorer sorts followed a similar trend.
FBOP/FBOPF1
Select Best flavoury FBOP's declined in demand and were mostly unsold. Better Orthodox FBOP's were firm to marginally easier, whilst the FBOPF1's were  lower by Rs. 20-40 per kg and more at times. Below Best FBOP/FBOPF1's were easier by Rs. 40 per kg, whilst the teas at the lower end declined by Rs. 40-60 per kg.

MEDIUM GROWN TEAS
BOP
Large Leaf teas gained by Rs. 50 per kg and more, whilst the others were firm and dearer to a lesser extent.
BOPF
Better teas were firm, whilst the others were Rs. 20-40 per kg easier.
OP/OPA
Well-made OP/OPA's declined by Rs. 40 per kg, whilst the others at the lower end were easier by Rs. 40-60 per kg.
PEKOE/PEKOE1
Bold PEK's were lower by Rs. 40-60 per kg, whilst the others were easier by Rs. 60-80 per kg. A few Select Best PEK1's were selectively dearer following special inquiry, whilst the others were lower by Rs. 20-40 per kg. Below Best types and others  declined by Rs. 60 per kg.
FBOP/FBOPF1
A few Select Best and Best FBOP's were firm to dearer by Rs. 20-40 per kg, whilst the others were easier by Rs. 40-50 per kg and more at times. Better FF1's were lower by Rs. 20 per kg, whilst the others in the Best and Below Best categories were easier by Rs. 40 per kg. Teas at the lower end declined by a similar margin.

BROKENS

BOP1A
Main Grade reducer varieties in the Best category were maintained at last week's levels, whilst the balance were firm to dearer by Rs. 20 per kg. Below Best varieties together with the poorer sorts were dearer by Rs. 10-20 per kg and more, on occasion.

DUSTS
DUST1
Select Best Dust1's were  limited  in availability due to early catalogue closure, however the few invoices that were available were firm to easier by Rs. 20-40 per kg. The Best varieties together with Below Best types and the poorer sorts, where quality was maintained, declined by Rs. 20-40 per kg, whilst the others declined further. Low Grown Best varieties appreciated by Rs. 40 per kg and more at times, whilst the others appreciated by Rs. 20-30 per kg. Best High and Mid Grown CTC teas declined by Rs. 20-40 per kg, whilst the Below Best varieties together with the poorer sorts were easier by a similar margin. Best Low Grown CTC teas declined by Rs. 40 per kg, whilst the others remained firm.
DUST
Clean leaf secondaries together with the poorer sorts declined by Rs. 40 per kg and more at times, whilst the Low Grown varieties were firm to dearer by Rs. 20-30 per kg.

CROP AND WEATHER
For the period 20 - 27 May 2025
Western/Nuwara Eliya Regions
The Western and Nuwara Eliya regions reported rainy weather throughout the week. Heavy showers are expected in both regions in the week ahead according to the Department of Meteorology.
Uva/Uda Pussellawa Regions
Bright mornings were reported throughout the week in both regions. Strong winds are expected in the Uva and Uda Pussellawa regions according to the Department of Meteorology.
Low Growns
Rainy weather was reported throughout the week in the Low Grown Region. The Department of Meteorology expects heavy showers in the Low Grown Region in the week ahead.
Crop Intake
The Western Medium, Nuwara Eliya, Uva and Uda Pussellawa regions maintained the crop intake, whilst the Western High and Low Grown regions reported a decrease.

MOMBASA AUCTION
SALE OF - 19TH and 20TH MAY 2025 (SALE NO.20)
Fairly improved general demand at irregular levels for the 206,458 packages (14,074,519.00 kilos) on offer; 33.70% was unsold.
MARKETS
Pakistan Packers were active but at lower levels with more enquiry from Yemen and other Middle Eastern countries. Kazakhstan and other CIS states lent strong support  with some participation from Bazaar. Afghanistan were active with less enquiry from UK. Egyptian Packers lent good support at steady rates with some interest from Russia. Sudan were absent while South Sudan maintained activity. Local Packers reduced enquiry with Somalia active at the lower end of the market.
OFFERINGS
Leaf Grades                 -    103,300 packages (6,738,219.00 kilos) - 40.21% unsold.
Dust Grades               -      85,200 packages (6,380,058.00 kilos) - 29.44% unsold.
Secondary Grades      -      17,258 packages (   923,846.00 kilos) - 15.76% unsold.
LEAF GRADES (M2 & M3)
BP1:
Best - Saw very irregular interest and varied between USC16 dearer with some teas USC42 and USC80 above previous levels to easier by USC26 and some lines were further discounted by USC38 and USC59.
Brighter - Were up to USC19 dearer to easier by up to USC15.
Mediums - KTDA mediums were irregular varying between USC12 dearer with some invoices up to USC22 above last rates to easier by up to USC17 while better plantation mediums were well sought after appreciating by up to USC42.
Lower Medium - Were steady to USC5 dearer to easier by up to USC12.
Plainer - Improved absorption at firm to USC10 above previous rates to easier by up to USC5.
PF1:
Best - Met irregular enquiry ranging between steady to USC22 dearer to easier by up to USC14.
Brighter - Mostly shed by up to USC28 but select invoices were up to USC2 above previous rates.
Mediums - KTDA mediums were irregular and varied between steady to dearer by up to USC7 to easier by up to USC16. Plantation mediums were firm to USC4 above previous levels to easier by up to USC7.
Lower Medium - Lost up to USC16 but some invoices gained by up to USC6.
Plainer - Irregular enquiry and ranged between steady to USC31 dearer to easier by up to USC5.

BANGLADESH AUCTION
SALE OF - 26TH MAY 2025 (SALE NO.04)
CTC LEAF: 25,948 packages of tea on offer met with a strong demand.
BROKENS/FANNINGS: Well made good liquoring types met with a stronger demand at mostly dearer rates and could be quoted between Tk.280/- and Tk.310/-. Below best were also a fairly strong market and were firm to slightly dearer selling between Tk.240/- and Tk.260/-. All other varieties were in good demand and were generally firm and these could be quoted between Tk.200/- and Tk.220/-. BLF teas sold quite well between Tk.160 and Tk.234/-.
DUST: 5,274 packages of tea on offer met with a good demand. Good liquoring Dusts sold well at around last levels. Their Mediums were also fully firm to slightly dearer closely following quality. Plain/BLF Dusts were well competed for and prices appreciated on quality. Blenders lent good support with fair interest from the Loose tea buyers.
COMMENTS: A stronger demand prevailed this week with the better sorts fetching good competition. Blenders lent useful support with more interest from the Loose tea buyers.
Dusts sold well.
Our Catalogue: (Sale 4) Avg : Tk 246.88, Sold 43.25% , (Sale 3) Avg : Tk 238.24, Sold 72.51%

KOLKATA SALE  CTC MARKET
MARKET REPORT:
Assams tending easier following decline in quality and also seeing some withdrawals.
Medium and plainer Dooars selling around last levels.
BUYING PATTERN:
Western India: Supporting the better teas
HUL : Good support
TCPL: Selective so far
Exporters : Fair enquiry
Other Internal/Local: Operating
KOLKATA SALE  ORTHODOX MARKET
MARKET REPORT:
Market opened to strong demand. Well made Whole leaf and Larger Brokens selling at  firm rates. Well made Smaller Brokens and cleaner Secondaries irregular around last  levels. Remainder Whole leaf, Brokens and browner stalkier Secondaries showing a seasonal decline irregular and at times tending lower. Leafy Fannings selling readily.
BUYING PATTERN:
Middle East : Active
CIS:  Good Support
KOLKATA SALE  DUST MARKET
MARKET REPORT:
Market opened to good demand. Dust selling firm to occasionally dearer. PD grades barely steady noticing few outlots at times.
BUYING PATTERN:
HUL: Mainstay
Western India: Good Support
Local Internal: Operated
Courtesy - J Thomas & Company Private Limited
JAKARTA AUCTION
SALE OF - 19TH MAY 2025 (SALE NO.20)
MARKET: - The total CTC leaf teas sold this week was 68.73 %(1,280,621.31kgs) of the total offering of 1,863,312.73Kgs.
BEST:- Best liquoring larger broken sold irregularly following quality, medium and smaller broken grades sold dearer following quality. There were very limited fanning grade on offer. Local and Regional packagers continued to be fairly active.
GOOD:- Larger broken sold barely steady, medium and smaller broken at the bottom end sold barely steady whilst select few invoices sold dearer following quality. Very limited fanning grade was on offer and fetched dearer prices following quality and competition. Regional packagers, upcountry buyers were fairly active.
BETTER MEDIUM & MEDIUM:- Larger broken eased by Rs 4 to 6, The top end medium and smaller broken sold barely steady to easier by Rs 2 to 3 whilst the bottom end in this category declined sharply by Rs 4 to 6. The prices continued to show no disparity between both the categories especially on the medium and smaller broken grades. Fanning grade on the better medium category fetched steady prices whilst the medium category sold easier by Rs 3 to 6. Major blenders and Western India Packateers were fairly active. Selective buying was seen from the upcountry and local buyers. Exporters were fairly active on on cleaner, blacker fanning. Larger broken continue to meet with selective buying from exporters.
PLAINERS:- Larger broken grades declined in value by Rs 4 to 6, the remainders eased by Rs 4 to 8 or more. Larger percentage of teas remain unsold in this segment. Limited buying from exporters. Major blenders were very choosy and internal buyers were selective along with the upcountry buyers.
BUYING PATTERN: - The major blenders off take was 50.64% of the total CTC leaf sold.
ORTHODOX LEAF
DEMAND: - Good but selective demand.
MARKET: - Select well made clean high grown whole leaf sold steady to easier following quality, others faced withdrawals. Other category sold at irregular levels, the bottom end of this category saws some out lots. Broken grade of the high grown category sold around last sold levels with select invoices fetching dearer prices whilst the others sold barely steady to easier.Fanning grades were barely steady to easier.
BUYING PATTERN: - Exporters were selective this week with up country buyers continuing to be fairly active closely following quality.
CTC DUST
DEMAND: - Fair demand.
MARKET: - CTC dust offer this week was at 509,730.46Kgs of which 388,707.22kgs were sold (76.26%).
There were no bolder dust on offer in the best teas , other grades sold irregular and easier closely following quality. Good category teas sold irregularly easier. Better medium & medium teas were barely steady to easier by Rs 2 to 3. Plainer teas sold easier by Rs 2 to 6.
BUYING PATTERN: - Major blenders were fairly active. Regional and local packeteers were selective along with the Up country and the local buyers . Exporters were fairly active on the bolder dust especially on cleaner and blacker sorts.
ORTHODOX DUST
DEMAND: - Good demand.
MARKET: - Primary dusts sold at irregular and dearer levels following quality, secondaries sold at irregular levels.
BUYING PATTERN: - Regional & local packateers were fairly active on primary dusts. Exporters were selective on the secondary dusts.
Courtesy - J.Thomas & Co. Pvt. Ltd
